info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 25 at 6:44AM CDT until May 25 at 7:45AM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 AM CDT FOR CAMERON AND CENTRAL WILLACY COUNTIES... At 644 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 26 miles east of Port Mansfield to near Laguna Heights to 10 miles south of Los Indios, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Harlingen, San Benito, Los Fresnos, South Padre Island, Rancho Viejo, Rio Hondo, Arroyo City, Southmost, Olmito and Port Of Brownsville. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
